[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Validator: Previous key replay] After rotate_key(), can signatures made with previous key still be accepted, enabling replay attacks with compromised old keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Validator: Key export for double-signing] Can a malicious validator export their private key and run two validator instances, enabling double-signing attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Validator: Storage backend compromise] If the KVStorage backend (file system, database) is compromised, can all validator private keys be extracted enabling complete network takeover? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Lifecycle: Key initialization] Is there a secure initialization flow that prevents keys from being created with predictable entropy during first boot? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Lifecycle: Key expiration] Does the key management system support key expiration, or can compromised keys remain valid indefinitely? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Lifecycle: Key revocation] Can keys be explicitly revoked to prevent their use after compromise, or must rotation be used? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Lifecycle: Key backup and recovery] If keys need to be backed up for disaster recovery, is there a secure backup mechanism that doesn't expose keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Lifecycle: Key deletion] When keys should be permanently deleted, are they securely erased from all storage locations including backups? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Integration: Consensus usage] When AptosBFT consensus uses these keys for block signing, can timing of key operations interfere with consensus progress? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Integration: Safety rules] Does the safety rules module properly handle key rotation during consensus rounds without violating safety guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Integration: Network key confusion] Can network identity keys and consensus keys get confused if stored in the same KVStorage, enabling identity spoofing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Integration: API exposure] Are CryptoStorage functions exposed via any API that could allow remote key export or signing requests? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Input: Empty name] Can an empty string '' be used as a key name, potentially causing collisions or storage backend errors? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Input: Unicode names] Are Unicode characters in key names properly handled, or can they cause encoding issues in KVStorage backend? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Input: Name length limits] Are there length limits on key names, or can extremely long names cause buffer overflows in storage backend? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Input: Reserved names] Can reserved system names be used as key names, potentially overwriting critical system keys? (High)
[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Input: Case sensitivity] Is key name comparison case-sensitive, or can 'ValidatorKey' and 'validatorkey' collide? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Edge case: Repeated rotation] If rotate_key() is called repeatedly in quick succession, can this cause storage overflow or version chain corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Edge case: Rotate then import] If rotate_key() is called immediately followed by import_private_key(), can the previous_version be lost? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Edge case: Sign non-existent key] If sign() is called for a key that was just deleted, is the error handled gracefully without panicking? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Edge case: Version equals current] In export_private_key_for_version(), if the requested version equals the current key, is it returned immediately or checked against previous? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Edge case: Empty message signing] Can sign() handle empty messages, or does serialization of empty data cause errors? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Resource: Key storage limits] Can an attacker create unlimited keys to exhaust storage space, causing validator failure? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Resource: Version history size] Can excessive key rotations create unbounded previous_version chains consuming excessive storage? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/crypto_kv_storage.rs] [Resource: Signing rate limits] Can rapid sign() calls exhaust CPU or create performance bottlenecks affecting consensus timing? (Medium)
